Reviews.Title: “Superb location and price”
Reviews.Author: kj98heel
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel has the best location! Just a couple minute walk to Circular Quay, the Opera house, bridge, ferries and public transportation. I traveled with my best friend for a girls trip and we had the time of our life. We enjoyed a flat white (best coffee drink) every morning in the little cafe, although we didn't dine at the hotel so I can't comment on that. The staff was very eager to help any way they could with recommendations, directions, taxis and our bags. We stayed in a king room and had all the room 2 traveling girls could need. I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION IN OLD-TOWN AREA”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamperDenver
Reviews.Content: "The Rocks" is the old town of Sydney, very close to Circular Quay, where all the hip and happenin' things are going on. It was originally Sydney's first hospital, so it is built with thick stone walls and therefore very quiet. It has been redone in a very contemporary style, and while our room was not huge, it was plenty big, with room for open suitcases and a nice big bathroom. It was painted dark charcoal gray which would usually make me think "UGH!!" but it was really quite beautiful. There was no view from the window. It looked out into a little courtyard, so while there was nothing to see, at least there was natural light. Nice little bar in the lobby, very friendly helpful staff who set us up with converters and directed us to internet cafes. And don't miss taking a tour of the Opera House even if you don't like opera. The story of this iconic building will amaze you.

Reviews.Title: “Its location, location, location for the Harbour Rocks Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noelglee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. The hotel was undergoing some building work, but that did not worry us. We also had the continental breakfast every morning (8 AUD if if remember), and it was great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in the history of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Good Location, Not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Igor F
Reviews.Content: Very poor service. Was not warned that hotel is undergoing renovations. Had to use emergency stair to go up to the third floor. No lift in the hotel. Had to use goods lift to move the luggage to the third floor. Staff didn't offer any assistance. Service is similar to the backpackers accommodation. Definitely not worth the money. Not family friendly. Very disappointing overall. The only positive is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wat a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Herman M
Reviews.Content: The exterior is 100 years old, clean, but old. Lobby a bit newer, and then you see the rooms! Brand new, modern, comfortable, clean. Staff very helpful. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: SydneyOzetraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, however our room was on street level and very noisy all night. Street sweepers at 5am didn't help the sleep situation either. Restaurant and rooms clean and good, staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “HRH in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: ElliotPaxtonDewar
Reviews.Content: Situated in the building of the first General Hospital in Sydney/ Australia the Harbour Rocks Hotel is a special boutique hotel at the centre of Sydney life. Informed and informative staff were always keen to help and advise. The accommodation was spotless and well appointed. There is a lovely private terrace for drinks. Shame about the noise in the morning both outside the hotel and in the corridor but perhaps that seemed worse because of the good time we had had the evening before!

Reviews.Title: “Experience in February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Robin G
Reviews.Content: Having been before to the Harbour Rocks Hotel in Sydney, we knew it was in an excellant location. However, this time we were very disappointed with the hotel itself. We could not have the room we had booked and the reason became obvious later when major refurbishment works were carried out. The room we were offered was described as a suite. It was large but very sparsely furnished. Clothes had to be left on the floor and the shower was ridiculous. The taps were about 6m from the shower head, it did not work properly and the room was flooded. To make it worse we were told nothing could be done over the weekend. The front desk appeared willing but were not efficient. We are unlikely to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Rocks is a winner”
Reviews.Author: KPTravel_12
Reviews.Content: Very cool boutique hotel at a great location and friendly, professional, knowledgeable staff that makes you feel welcome right from the start. Scarlett, the adjoining restaurant, is very nice, elegant yet affordable for dinner, and a big buffet for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: bferguss
Reviews.Content: Suite at the top with a view of the Opera House and Circular Quay Metres to the Rocks restaurants not to mention the in house restaurant German chef Sabine very good Will stay here again had a ball 5 min walk to Sydney CBD and don't forget only 62 meters to the Lohenbrou Kellar restaurant and others closer

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Location!”
Reviews.Author: Carina L
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney recently and stayed at the newly refurbished Rocks Harbour Hotel. It's a very nice hotel and the Heritage Superior Queen Room is spacious and very comfortable. All the modern touches and creature comforts are provided but if I had to be 'pickey' the bathroom is small and the closet space could be a little larger (minor details for me). The location is excellent, great view of the harbour in all its spenda, within walking distance to the ferries at Circular Quay, Opera House and down town CBD. The Rocks Quarter is well seviced with shops, cafes, pubs and markets during the week-end. It's a lively and popular area.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: ValerieTrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Harbour Rocks hotel in late February and can't recommend it enough - if only for its location at the heart of The Rocks, 5 minutes walk to Circular Quay & the Opera House. Our room was at the first floor at the back and we had a partial view of the opera, which was an added bonus. The hotel is undergoing renovations and the newly refurbished corner room we had was great: comfortable bed, very bright, spacious enough room & bathroom and excellent powerful shower. The only downside is due to its amazing location in the heart of restaurants, bars, etc. it can be a little noisy at night though we did notice it was quieter during the week than on weekend nights. We also stayed at much posher Observatory Hotel during our trip and would definitely chose Harbour Rocks over it again next time we're in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and WOW love the new look”
Reviews.Author: UpTheOwls
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd visit to this perfectly located hotel. WOW what a difference. Stayed hr in November 2010 and fell in love with the place. Some 15 months later we go back and hardly recognised the place. The green decor has gone and we now have very modern contemporary painted walls. An minor setback of a double room being allocated to us rather than a twin was sorted out within minutes by those on Reception. The bathrooms, comfort everything is fantastic. I only have 1 minor complaint - would have been nice to open a window. However loved the roman blinds and roller blinds at the windows. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden GEM!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Polyceph
Reviews.Content: This fabulous boutique hotel has got to be one of central Sydney's hidden gems. Just behind George St at The Rocks its a stone's throw from Circular Quay, The Opera House, and all that the harbour has to offer. From the entry with its comfy chairs, "homey" book shelves, and registration desk, which is shared with a wine bar, to the well appointed room and fantastic helpful staff our visit was excellent. My wife and I stayed there in February for a weekend getaway and have certainly found our "home" in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, a few issues”
Reviews.Author: trip atkins
Reviews.Content: Hotel is currently undergoing renovation as of March 5, 2012. No working elevator. We had 3rd floor room which was not a problem for us, but would be for a lot of people. We had no notice of this before arrival, and no adjustment to the bill. Room was clean and comfortable enough. Great location in Sydney- walking distance to nearly everything tourists go to, and very close to ferry and train and a lot of restaurants. Hotel will try to sneak a few extra dollars from foreign tourists- like fees for using credit card and attempt to bill in US dollars instead of Australian, at a premium to exchange rate. Kind of a quirky boutique hotel, but location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: BhamAl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Harbour Rocks for 3 nights in 2/12. The hotel is in a great location and has been recently renovated. The lobby area is small but nice and there are several good restaurants on site and nearby. The room was clean but the bathroom was one of the smallest I have ever had. We were also on the first floor which was not ideal since it overlooked a courtyard that contained public restrooms. Overall it's a great location but try to get a room on the second floor with a decent sized bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road, a tad disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy_Mango
Reviews.Content: We were only staying at this hotel for one night, and for that I am thankful. Nice hotel, staff very helpful and friendly, but the standard rooms (Heritage) are like shoeboxes - very, very small and cramped. The hotel is over 3 floors (possibly 4, but we did not visit the restaurant which may have been on a lower level). Situated in one of Sydney's historical buildings, there is only one lift, about 1.5 metres high, and used for luggage - therefore not a good hotel for folks with mobility problems. This is not made aware to potential guests when booking/or on the website. Very pricey too .... $330 for one night, and definitely not worth the cost ......

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Rocks Hotel - A Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sue R
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! The Harbour Rocks is a quant, comfortable hotel situated in a great location in The Rocks in Sydney. Rooms are spacious and well-appointed and hotel staff is extremely helpful. Centrally located it is a short walk to the Sydney Opera House, the Botanical Gardens, ferries and bus transportation. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if this is your first time visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Great staff great location great heritage hotel. The Staff at the Harbour Rocks Hotel were great and went out of their way to look after us when we stayed there recently. Abdullah, Alanna and ben at the front desk looked after me when they realised I had bad legs and placed me on the ground floor to save my walking. The were exceptional and went out ot their way to make our stay a wonderful experience. Thanks again John Reynolds

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Rocks - Great location”
Reviews.Author: SaxTherapist
Reviews.Content: A perfect location, close to many restaurants and Circular Quay which is a transportation hub in Sidney. The staff are great, particular mention to Abdallah, he was very helpful and made some excellent recommendations. Book early for a better price than walking in off the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Lovely hotel. Modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: HenTravels
Reviews.Content: In the heart of " The Rocks" this little gem is a perfect hub for exploring Sydney. I only had a long weekend so wanted to be close to all the action. A short walk to the ferries. A view of Sydney opera house from my room. Darling harbour near by. The bridge climb practically over my head. And restaurants and bars galore to choose from. Good buffet breakfast as well tho 'continental' (no eggs / bacon) but lots of choice. Room (superior queen) was a good size and bed was vey comfortable. They are nearly done their renovation and their gym will open then. Would happily stay here again and the price was very fair for this area of the city

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bellaview
Reviews.Content: Although only here for a 2 night stay, this hotel was a brilliant location for seeing the sights of Sydney. The hotel was undergoing renovation while we were there, however with minimal disturbance to the guests and the staff were very friendly and accomodating. Our room was lovely, modern and clean, with great views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House (although this was obscured by a large tree, never mind, we knew it was there)! The hotel is full of character and charm, definatately recommend for ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Bryce_Kath
Reviews.Content: Well I'm amazed at the reviews here, I found the hotel to be very clean by Sydney standards, Staff were excellent, Great Location, great breakfast Very impressed. We only had the basic room.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Neilsong
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January, found reception friendly and helpful, great room. The location is the best being next door to lots of restaurants and a short walk to the cbd.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huffington
Reviews.Content: We only had one night here, but it was great. The hotel had been recently renovated, and fused high quality modern finishes with old, rustic touches. The hotel was booked by a travel agent friend, and we had no idea what it was going to be like. When we arrived, and the solid woodern automatic doors parted, we were delighted with what we saw. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too pricey”
Reviews.Author: pstylist
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel & I also booked their meeting room for 2 days but I found it to be quite expensive for what it is. Yes, location is good but the bedroom & meeting room were small & every small extra cost a lot! Food is also quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: djangoGibsons
Reviews.Content: Sydney is a vibrant city with much on offer. Most of the action is around Circular Quay with the Botanical Gardens and Sydney Opera House on one side and the trendy Rocks district on the other. The Harbour Rocks Hotel is tucked in a reasonably quiet street just behind the main thoroughfare of George Street, home to boutiques and designer stores including UGG, Louis Vuitton as well as many street-side restaurants and pubs. It is a short walk to the water with fabulous views of Sydney Harbour and the Bridge. The hotel is housed in what seems like an old grain factory with small elevators for luggage only. Guests take the stairs. The lobby is light and the bar is right next to the reception desk so you can check in and order a nice cool beer at the same time! The downstairs restaurant that opens out onto the alleyway in front of the hotel, offers full or continental breakfast as well as dinner. Staff are friendly and the service is good. Rooms are comfortable with views towards the harbour, TV, lounge area, tiled bathroom with robes. The best part is the location - you literally walk out through the automatic glass front doors onto Harrington Street and into the buzz of downtown Sydney. Average prices are AUS$210 per night in a Sydney hotel. Here we paid $319 for 4 people in the room, making use of the sofa bed. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: mirrorless
Reviews.Content: A hotel with a character. It is located in the heart of "the rocks" district. It's a comparatively small heritage-style hotel but outfitted to modern standards. The rooms are kind of small but nothing is missing and everything's tidy. Nice restaurant. An obvious choice if you want to stay in the center but prefer a moody place over the big modern options.

Reviews.Title: “Just refurbished, good location and quiet room”
Reviews.Author: mark_mb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been refurbished since I last stayed here. The style of the rooms is interesting (I must admit mine did remind me of a prison cell when I first arrived), but the fit-out is generally of high standard. Good bed, nice bathroom and surprisingly quiet at night time. The windows actually open which is always a bonus. You're staying in a great location, so if you're just after a good night's sleep after exploring the city, this is a great place to stay. If you plan to spend a lot of time in your room, you may wish to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: HEP_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel, which formerly was a warehouse, has just been refurbished, so when we returned after 8 years, we were a bit disappointed, as the historic atmosphere, which captivated us at that time, has been lost. The rooms are almost hi-tec modern and could be rooms in many hotels all over the world. That said, if you want to be close to Sydney's traffical centre at Circular Quay and the fabulous Opera House, Harbour Rocks Hotel is the place. Also because it's situated in a quiet street. We stayed in what the hotel calls a double heritage room. The beds were fine, and there was good reading light for bed-reading. The room had an electric kettle with complimentary tea/coffee and a small safe. The room had adequate cupboard space, but the air-con was rather noisy. The bathroom sported a shower, and furthermore there was a clothesline, - very handy when you are on a long vacartion. Please observe that the hotel only have a baggage-lift. Nothing for guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Building Site!”
Reviews.Author: Donna D
Reviews.Content: my Husband and I unfortunately had the displeasure to stay here for two nights on the 22nd and 23rd November this year. When we arrived we were greeted with what I can only explain looked like a church pulpit serving as a reception desk. It did not improve any when we went to our BOX room which was painted in a Muddy Brown colour with no pictures or mirrors on the walls and believe me the room needed all the help it could get, we went to reception and asked if our room was a Heritage Room that we had booked and we were told yes, we informed the Gent that the room was nothing like the picture on the website and we were very unhappy with both the room and the renovations that are going on that we knew nothing about and if we had known we would have not come to this Hotel. We were offered a complimentary Continental Breakfast which we were loathed to accept as the workmen started work about 07.45am. On the second day we decided to try breakfast and soon regretted this decision as whilst eating at our table we heard someone hammering directly above and the next minute my Husband and I were covered in dust and debris from above, we certainly let the manager know in no uncertain terms our feelings about this hotel. This hotel is an accident waiting to happen and it should have been closed down whilst the major renovations were done, the management and owners of this establishment do not care about their guests or reputation and hopefully if enough people write about their nightmare stays here then it will do harm to the hotel in the future. My warning to anyone who is about to stay in this excuse for a hotel is DO NOT or if you want to risk it take a HARD HAT and a MASK so you can breath through all the DUST. The only positive thing to say is the location of this place is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and has real character”
Reviews.Author: Jollyjambo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with real character. It is an old building but quite modern and as others have said it is currently undergoing renovation. It was quite noisy during the day mainly between 9 - 5 as they make changes to the basement area. They said there should be no noise before 9 but some of the tradesman were a bit keen to get started and on one occassion started just after 7. The rooms are nice but a bit strange. Ours had a huge entrance area, an adequate and comfortable sleeping area but the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. It does have a toilet, sink and shower but couldn't hold two people at the same time. If you are a person of any size it could seem quite claustrophobic. It seems like a weird use of space but maybe they were limited to the changes they could make to the original structure. The continental breakfast was very good but despite being told every day that it was included in the price of our room they still tried to charge us for it when we checked out. Please note that none of the rooms provide a view of the Opera House or Bridge despite what some pictures suggest. Internet connection was available but very pricy, much better and cheaper going to the supermarket across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location Not the Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becstar79
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is amazing, you are right in The Harbor Rocks area and can pretty much walk everywhere. When we were in Sydney there was amazing night and day markets right outside the hotel which made for a great experience. Unfortunatly the hotel its self is nothing to get excited about. Our room was on the bottom floor and we had a window that looked out into a courtyard area. We could hear all the noise from outside which went on all day and night. Due to it being so close to the ground you really could feel people could see in. This was a shame as we had to keep the curtains drawn all the time. The room was very dark and not much natural light come in the very small window even with the curtain open. The bed was comfortable and gave for a good night sleep. The bathroom was very small (you could only fit one person in at a time) and didnâ€™t have much room to store your personal stuff. The staffs were helpful and helped us get a courtesy bus back to the airport (which you had to pay for). As we arrived late on Thursday night we got room service this was not that good and very expensive (would recommend looking for a restaurant in the area). Overall very expensive hotel for what you got but if youâ€™re looking for location location then this is the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in mid October. The hotel was being renovated at the time. Unfortunately we were not aware of this until we arrived from interstate. There was no mention of this on their website. Our overnight stay was a shambles due to the ongoing noise from the constuctions going on, particularly the tradie with the drill outside our room at 7.15am. After complaining to the manager who was most apologetic he advised that he would get back to us with some form of rate reduction as compensation. It is now 4 weeks and several e-mails to the hotel later and we have still not heard a thing. Obviously the management of this hotel group has no regard for their paying customers. The hotel website also misreprents the accommodation. It is overpriced, small and drab wiith not even a box of tissues in the bathroom. If this is the way this hotel group treats their clients I would advise against anybody staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, but poor renovations”
Reviews.Author: MichelinStarred
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Rocks hotel is very well situated in the Rocks district of Sydney just minutes from the harbour and surrounding restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful rushing to get our room ready when we arrived earlier than expected and helping us find a cab at 4:30 in the morning to the airport...even offering us snacks for the early ride. Despite these perks, I don't think I would go back. You are definitely paying for the location and for this price could find other hotels with better rooms. The Harbour Rocks is under going a major renovation leaving most of the hotel covered in plastic wrap. Our room had been renovated but it looked to be rather cheaply done with a lot of paint and simple furniture. Despite having a renovated room, the bathroom was abysmal. The sink was no more than a small sink with no counter forcing us to leave all our toiletries either on the floor or in the main room. The shower was small with an unmovable head that forced by over 6 foot husband to duck the entire time. And overall it was small and uncomfortable. Getting ready for the evening proved impossible. If they are spending so much time and effort on renovations they should have done something to make the bathroom better.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Rocks”
Reviews.Author: napierrussell
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service from all staff. They couldnt do enough to make our stay an enjoyable one. From a great value bar and restaurant to neat and tidy rooms, a definite must.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller72_11
Reviews.Content: The interior of the hotel is nice and currently being refurbished so the rooms look fantastic and the location is great as well. As the hotel is literally a few doors away from the busiest pub in the Rocks area, it's literally impossible to get any sleep. Considering the noise level and the fact breakfast wasn't included in the room price, it definitely wasn't value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately priced great location”
Reviews.Author: ejackman
Reviews.Content: With so much to see and do in Sydney, the Harbour Rocks Hotel is an excellent choice. Within walking distance are excellent restaurants and major sites, including the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Rooms are small, but adequate. There is not elevator but there is a lift for luggage. There is an small dining area with a limited breakfast.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Cool looking place but the rooms left much to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: The_Villla_Hermosa
Reviews.Content: The history of this place was cool, the lobby inviting but the room was so-so. I liked the fact that we could actually open the window to get some nice air in there. The breakfast was good and I really liked the cafe they had there....it looked newer. For the price we paid I guess I expected the rooms to be nicer?!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe once the renovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: Duniasafiri
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and restored heritage facility can't make up for noisy rooms, ongoing construction, disconnected heat and air systems. Perhaps when the work is done and if you're lucky enough to get a room away from the street then give it a try. Otherwise look elsewhere for better value and amenities

Reviews.Title: “not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: JJJuuLeS
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed with this hotel, and found the staff a little rude. Yes Boutique, is small and quaint, but the rooms were rediculously small, even by UK standards, our childrens' bathroom, you could sit on the loo and wash you hands! We asked for adjoining rooms, but was not given them, luckily our children are older, but I would not be happy if they weren't teenagers. Our room was on the back of the hotel, and the noise through the night was awful, restaurants and bin lorries made a horrendous noise. We ate in the restaurant the first evening, and found it over priced, poor portion sized and the deserts seemed bought in. The location is the only good thing about this hotel. Having stayed in many hotels around the world, this is the only one that I would readily tell people to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: hr84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Rocks at the beginning of our trip to Sydney and loved everything about it- we learned later that it was the first hospital in Sydney, so it had a lot of character and was a perfect little boutique hotel in an incredible location in the Rocks. The room was immaculate as was the pure white bathroom- The views of the opera house and harbour bridge were just a bonus in this quaint little place and will definitely recommend it and go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kenwtravel
Reviews.Content: Right in the centre of the Rocks. Helpful and friendly staff. Aircon not working on our visit, hopefully just temporary!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Tilerman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal spot to enjoy the hustle and bustle of the Circular Keys area of Sydney.The hotel is quiet and clean although I would say that the upstairs rooms are the better ones ( no public lifts and two storeys high though. ) Compete with the noisey Parakeets each morning for the sugar on your table...fascinating and stroll the street markets at night.Everything we ordered arived on time and local advice from the friendly desk persons was invaluable...loveley little hotel

Reviews.Title: “What a con!”
Reviews.Author: johndcanberra
Reviews.Content: Around mid-May I booked a Harbour View Room with guaranteed views of the harbour and Sydney Opera House. My wife and I visit Sydney several times a year and normally stay at another hotel, but this was a special occasion (a milestone birthday for my wife) and I decided to pay more, for the harbour view. Due to the significant gap between the booking and the stay I confirmed the booking (with the hotel itself, not a booking agency) two days before we left for Sydney. The gentleman checked the records and the booking was confirmed with no additional comments. In order to show my wife where we were staying, the day before we left I showed her the video which was running at the hotel website and showed the views from a Harbour View Room. She was looking forward to the stay. When we arrived at the hotel on a Saturday afternoon, with a full schedule of activities to follow, the room I was allocated had no harbour view. I was then told that due to internal renovations and a renovation in an adjoining building there were no Harbour View rooms. I complained and explained that had I been told that when I had rung two days earlier I would have stayed elsewhere. (I also found another person complaining about the same problem, and another the next morning.) As I had a series of appointments and no time to spare I was then shown three different rooms , in ascending order of quality. The first was very small, just above the street and when I asked it was confirmed that I could expect it to be noisy that night (a Saturday). I would rate it two star! The second was tiny, had exposed plumbing and painted timbers in the ceiling (a "heritage" room apparently) and views of adjoining steel roofs and building infrastructure. I would rate it less than two star. The third room was bigger, a good size, and again above the road but up another level and said to be not as noisy as the first. Time was running out and we took it along with the comment that we would be recompensed for the "inconvenience." It is a good three star room. The recompense we were offered was a complimentary breakfast both mornings of our stay, free wine or drinks at the bar either of the two nights, a discount on the room and the attention of the manager (who would be appraised of the situation) when he was on duty the following Monday when we were due to depart. We ate the breakfasts. When we went for our free drinks on the Sunday night we found the bar was not open that night. When I went to pay the account on the Monday morning I was presented with a bill for more than my original booking amount. The manager was nowhere to be seen. I complained and was offered a discount of $20 per night. Asked if I was happy with this I said no but as I was sick of discussing the matter would pay it as I didn't have time to argue any more and had better things to do. The staff I spoke to were not particularly concerned about what had occurred. I should comment that the young lady who showed us the rooms was extremely nice and helpful. Management is a joke however. In addition, a week after my star this hotel's website was still showing a video of views from their Harbour View Rooms despite the fact that i had told them they should stop running it!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: kitkatau
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time at the Harbour Rocks! Ideally located, wonderful food, quiet and comfortable. Best hotel in Sydney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it's worth location”
Reviews.Author: Vacaybeekay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times for business. Rooms are tiny and basic but it has heritage value and a great location. Be aware that room service menu is very basic, and only available certain nights. You are surrounded by great restaurants but when traveling on your own for business sometimes it's nice to have room service in front if the tv- poor tv reception and no room service makes this impossible . But overall, charming heritage hotel in fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hess63
Reviews.Content: Harbour Rocks is a great place to stay. The only negative is that when we stayed we were on the top floor which involved walking up 2 flight of stairs. Not a great option when travelling with seniors. For the price that we paid I would have thought that the rooms would be a little nicer. We stayed in a Jr Suite. Not a lot of room. The best promotion about this hotel is that the management were great and very helpful and the location is great. It is right in the rocks area surrounded by a lot of history and attractions. Another great attraction was that you also received a free breakfast. Would recommend this hotel but I would recommend to stay on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location; claustrophobic room”
Reviews.Author: DT25
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again because of the outstanding location in The Rocks. We could walk to most places we wanted to see. Weekend craft market is right outside. Staff were ok- after lecturing us about American deficiencies, the reception clerk told us the secret to getting free Internet (you have to be a member) which is otherwise way too costly. Room small enough to be claustrophobic, but comfortable and quiet enough- you shouldn't be spending your time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: williamskez
Reviews.Content: I heard about this hotel from a friend who loves the place and stayed on that reccommendation. I had a brillant stay and could not have asked for more. Its a charming little hotel with a nice little restaurant and bar downstairs. The staff are very warm and friendly and found myself talking to them quite often. The rooms are very clean as well. I was offered breakfast on check in for a special price of $15 which was cheap compared with other hotel breakfasts I had sometime more than twice that. The location is perfect. Right in the heart of Sydney. The harbour is right there. I would not hesitate to stay again. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BenitaOSU
Reviews.Content: The Rocks is a great place to be in Sydney and the Harbour Rocks Hotel is right in the middle of it! True, there is no elevator but there is a baggage lift so you don't have to carry your bags up the stairs. The staff was very helpful and our room was always clean. TV was iffy (sound was bad on the news station we wanted to watch). Did not eat at the hotel restaurant. All food in Sydney is expensive compared to USA. Our room was small but adequate for our needs and the bed was comfortable - I slept good every night.

Reviews.Title: “It Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: blackbeauty1951
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a gem, a well-refined rock. I lucked out and got the handicapped room with a nice open bath. My adult son thought that it was so cool. The rooms are clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the hotel is perfectly located. Nearly everything that you would want in Sydney is within walking distance either of itself or transportation to it, e.g. ferries, buses etc. Excellent restaurants, the Opera House, the museum, the Observatory, shopping, the ferries and historic sites are all nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Had a few Hiccups at the Harbour Rocks Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayFreakxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days here in april with my fiance celebrating a special occasion. On arrival our room was clean, however a packet of biscuits in our mini bar were 3 months out of date. Our air con didn't work either, which didnt really bother us the 1st night, but on the 2nd night it was very warm, the room does have a ceiling fan but it make loud noises so we couldnt keep it on during the night, we filled out a maintenance card and left it down to reception asking someone to take a look at our air con, when we arrived back from sightseeing that night, air con still wasnt working, so we phoned up reception and they came up and looked at it, tried to fix it with no luck, they then brought up a pedestal fan which didnt really help, so we got moved at about midnight to another room. When we got to our new room the air con in that room didnt work either but because it was late at night we just wanted to sleep. The room we got moved to had a view of the Sydney Opera House, which your supposed to pay extra for but i wouldnt recommend paying the extra to get the view as you can see it if you walk 2 minutes from the hotel. Another problem we encountered with this hotel was that we asked the hotel receptionist to book us a taxi for a few hours away. We came down on time and waited in reception for our taxi, still no word 10 minutes later, the receptionist assured us it would be here soon its just running late, another 10 minutes passed still no word, so she helped us flag down a taxi for a few minutes as we needed to get to central station. The taxi still never showed so we got our own taxi. Another thing to note about this hotel is they dont have a lift - they have a small luggage lift - when we arrived we went to put our luggage in here but it was filled with bed sheets so we had to carry 3 cases up 2 flights of stairs, which wasnt too easy! The good things about this hotel would be the location, right beside good restaurants and shops, and near were the ferries are, also very near to the Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. We also ordered room service one of the nights and the food was lovely and reasonably priced. They also have a wide selection of in room movies to choose from at $15.95. All in all i was very disappointed with the hotel, especially as me and my fiance were staying here to celebrate our recent engagement. We definately would not stay here again, and i would not recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST vacation ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: salliebp
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Rocks Hotel was beyond amazing. As it was our anniversary, we decided to splurge on the penthouse apartment, and we are still blown away by the perfection of the entire experience. Alana and the entire staff were incredibly welcoming when we arrived after a long and tiring flight. We didn't really know what to expect, but when we got up to our apartment, our jaws hit the floor! We had the entire top floor to ourselves, a gorgeous balcony, our own private hot tub, a bottle of champagne chilling in an ice bucket, and the most drop dead gorgeous view imaginable. The Opera House was directly in front of us and we felt like we could almost reach out and touch it. To the left was the bridge, and everywhere else we looked were the beautiful skyline buildings and the Sydney harbor. The location was beyond belief perfect, and we are counting the days until we can return to the truly most fabulous spot in Sydney. If you are headed that way, grab the penthouse and you will be in for the experience of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice and personal”
Reviews.Author: jennaho
Reviews.Content: A good boutique style hotel in the best location in the rocks area of Sydney, so close to everything. Nice comfy rooms and friedly staff. Recommend if you like a smaller hotel without all the frills,

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in the best part of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Shane1977
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. Its small but quaint and there's a certain charm you get which you kind of miss from all the bigger chains around the world. Even though the rooms are a bit on the smaller side they are tastefully done and you don't really mind. The locations is spot on and if you stay there on the weekend you can stroll through the rocks market. We have stayed in Sydney(Darling Harbour) before but the "ROCKS" is the place to stay, everything is close by and you can spend days just wandering around the streets stopping by for beers, coffee & food on the way. Also, as the hotel is barely 5-10mins from the Circular Quay you can hop on the ferries & even the trains to travel to anywhere including the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, classy place, an aura of authenticity”
Reviews.Author: scash80
Reviews.Content: I especially enjoyed the staircase, the large spacious room, the wooden beams and fantastic sturdy bed. A nice walk from the Rocks, the best location in Sydney city centre. It was expensive I suppose, but I prefer to give my money to such 'boutique' style hotels with a sense of history rather than to the large commerical chains nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - staff unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: nross6
Reviews.Content: I loved the location, but I did not like the ants in my room or the way the staff handle the situation. I felt the staff overall was not helpful or friendly. I was also surprised at the cost of wi-fi. When I checked out I was told a price that was $75 more than my confirmed price. Luckily I had my confirmation from my reservation. If they gave more than 1 towel per person I might not have needed a clean towel everyday. The 1st room I received was roomy but right on the street and very noisy in the morning. As a single traveler on that 1st night I was nervous being right on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mactezza
Reviews.Content: My secretary booked this welcome releif for me over the internet. I must say I was not expecting much at all. I was overwhelmed which is a change. I usually stay at the Sebel Peir One and the Citigate but neither could hold a candle to this hotel. Even though they are all Mirvac properties the difference is significant. I will find myself staying here on a more frequent basis.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but felt we could do better”
Reviews.Author: Libra419
Reviews.Content: On the whole, we didn't mind this hotel. There is no denying that the location is ideal, and we were so glad that we stayed in The Rocks area. That said, we felt that for the rate we paid for this hotel, we could have paid just slightly more per night and gotten so much more in return. Although the hotel was advertised as having wi-fi, it was not free, and it turned out that wi-fi access wasn't available in our room, so we had to sit out in the hallway in order to access the internet, after paying $19.95 per day to access it, which we found more than a little annoying. Also contributing to our disappointment was the ground floor room we were assigned when we first checked in. While it was a ground floor room, it felt more like a basement/dungeon, and did not seem anything like the photos displayed on the hotel's website when we booked online. We requested a different room for our second and third nights there, and our new room was a huge improvement (although wi-fi access still required frequent squatting in the hallway). Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the location and provided that you secure a room above the ground floor, but I think it would be possible to do better for only a little more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fab time”
Reviews.Author: earthhours
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Rocks Hotel because it was in the perfect location for us. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very good and the location is perfect, what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Ninkasi
Reviews.Content: As in many times in the past, we found this hotel based onTripAdvisor reviews and again we were not disappointed. Having lived in Sydney 3 years ago for 18 months we knew the general area where we wanted to stay on this short trip and this turned out to be a real gem. The location is perfect for the Rocks area and it is a short stroll to Circular Quay and even the city centre. The hotel is a converted commercial building dating back over 100 years and it is small but a very welcome change to the big 'chrome and glass' commercial chain hotels. Our room on the first floor was very comfortable...a small reception area complete with Victorian fireplace leading to the bed area complete with wardrobe and all the usual things like safe / fridge / television / coffee maker etc. The bathroom was small, but absolutely adequate and everything was in good order.Even though the room looked on to the street, it was very quiet and we had no issues with noise at all. When we booked on line we did not take the optional breakfast for AUD$23pp as this seemed quite steep for a continental breakfast, but when we checked in we were offered breakfasts for AUD$15 which was much better. The breakfasts were lovely and very relaxed in the breakfast room that also opened out to a small balcony for 'al fresco' dining. The staff were all very friendly and efficient and we found the cost reasonable compared to the other hotels in the area - that said, Sydney is centainly not a 'value' destination and we found most things quite a bit more expensive than the major centres in the States and Europe. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return here and recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hardwil
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel right in the centre of the Rocks - an ideal position for circular quay and the harbour bridge. The rooms were very comfortable and the staff were excellent. We had complimentary breakfast which was in their very nice restaurant. We really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: goingsomewheresoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for two nights in a junior suite on the third level. We had a partial view of the Opera House and the Harbour bridge and our room was a very good size. Beds were comfy, and our towels were changed daily. In terms of location, it is fantastic! Just a short 5 minute stroll from Circular Quay, and the Rocks Markets on Friday night, Saturday and Sunday were right outside our door. We didn't dine in the hotel restaurant, there were too many other options all within 2 minutes walk. We had no problems catching a taxi from out the front either. The only downside was noise - as our room was on the corner of Harrington Street and the Suez canal there was a far bit of noise from the nightclub a couple of doors down. It closes at 2am but the street doesn't quieten down until after 3am. Then the garbage trucks start arriving at 5am. Not a big deal, but taking ear plugs is a good idea. We were surprised that the windows were not double glazed. I would definitely stay here again, but would request a room on the other side of the hotel. We also found the front desk staff to be a mixed bag - on the first night, the staff member didn't even bother to make eye contact or acknowledge us when we got back around midnight, whereas on the second night a different staff member inquired about our evening and wished us good night.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Rae_MB
Reviews.Content: It appears that they dont like women travelling alone, the desk staff were patronisingly unhelpful when I arrived, and difficult to locate (they hide in the office on the right hand side) for most of my stay, I was given a room that the couple ahead of me had rejected, I rejected it also, two and a half floors up, at the far end, next to the cleaners room, with a view of a brick wall. I was moved to a room marginally bigger and lower but with the same view. Getting sugar to add to my coffee in the room was almost as difficult as extracting bone marrow. The room was clean but towels were not changed during my stay. The staff that checked me out were very nice, but by then my stay was over...and they overcharged me. There are nicer places to stay nearby for about the same money, choose one of those.

Reviews.Title: “The Rocks, Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Bibbbabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the Rocks, great area, great market Friday night, Saturday and Sunday afternoon. Ideal location for circular quay, with access to all ferries. Opera house is breathtaking great views from quay and well the coathanger (as the ozzies call it) Sydney Harbour Bridge. Let me tell you none of the pics you see do any of these icons justice!. We Climbed it, wow thats a life experience. Get on the tour bus around sydney, its not really that big but will give you an idea where to walk!. Go to Potts Point on Sunday afternoon for lunch, then walk back through the botanical gardens to city. Visit Bondi and Manley, walk round old sydney, get to know the areas, they are great people and its a wonderful place. Back to hotel.Rooms are fine,slightly smaller, but hey, your in one of the best cities in the world. get out there. Do I sound optimistic. Yes I am. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. A real little gem.”
Reviews.Author: Oldandnew
Reviews.Content: Great location. Lovely views. Very friendly staff. We are so pleased we found this charming & will be making it a regular place to stay when we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes yet again!”
Reviews.Author: CathyWinchesterUK
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Harbour Rocks Hotel during March, we had no hesitation in booking in there again for our trip to Sydney in November. Once again we were backwards & forwards as fitted in other trips out of Sydney during our 3week stay in Australia. Every time we returned we were welcomed as 'old friends'. Every room we were allocated had character, was clean & comfy culminating in our last night with wonderful opera house view. No the rooms & lobby are not huge but this place does not compete or compare with the anonymous corporate hotels. BUT it more than makes up with its superb location (right in the heart of the action of The Rocks & opposite the Lowenbrau Beer Keller!), character, such friendly helpful staff (stored our luggage whilst we were away) & delightful intimate breakfast room especially if fortunate enough to be on the balcony overlooking The Lanes with resident lorikeets . MP Winchester UK

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: UpTheOwls
Reviews.Content: After a week of travelling between Singapore, Brisbane and Ayres Rock, the Harbour Rocks was a welcome sight. Great hotel. Staff were very friendly and nothing was ever too much trouble for them. The room - linen changed everyday - bedding and towels. athroom was a good size with a walk in shower. Beds were lovely and comfy. For a change we had ample coathangers at this hotle - more than the 4 we had in Ayres Rock. We were fortunate enough to have breakfast included in our package. For an extra AUS$5 we could have the hot full breakfast, consisting of sausages, tomatoes, bacon, mushrooms, eggs, toast and has browns. Location - was absolutely brilliant. 5 mins to Circular Quay. Minutes way form the harbour. almost under the Harbour Bridge. Some great restaurants all in walking distance and a lovely selection of coffee shops and smaller eateries. On Friday evening there was a craft market in the area near out hotel, then at the weekend the weekli Rocks Market. Will definitiely stopp there again - loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Double Booked our Friends pre paid room!”
Reviews.Author: oldpaddler3
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the hotel by our agent because of its great location. We had friends that had been traveling with us for the last month. They had booked their room seperate from us and had pre paid for the room. Upon arrival our room was ready but our friends room had been let to someone else and they had no other rooms. To this point no refund has been made. Very Poor Business Practice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: johnlight0
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time when I stayed at the Harbour Rocks it's location is great and staff are so warm and friendly. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful - great views of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: jeanetteBerwickVic
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights - it was wonderful - great views very clean wonderful staff can not wait to return - restaurant is fantastic only great things to say about this wonderful hotel - walking distance to every thing was very very good - thank you to all

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Famdragon
Reviews.Content: Extremely noisy. Basement type room with passing traffic about a metre away from bed. No double glazing. Heard passing traffic and loud passer-byes late into night. Constant movement of people upstairs shook the room day and night. Internet cost ridiculous when a lot of places give you a few hours for free. Especially with the high cost of a very poor room...and then to charge a 3% surcharge if you use Visa etc. As i have said NEVER AGAiN

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated!”
Reviews.Author: UkATourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely, pretty location. We had booked a junior suite through our travel agent. However, a junior suite is a bit misleading! There were 4 of us and there were 2 comfy, clean single beds and a double sofa bed that dipped in the middle and was far too uncomfortable. The sofa bed would have looked cleaner and fresher if like the single beds had crisp white duvets, but it had no duvet and just sheet with a shabby and unclean looking blanket. We asked if we could upgrade, but no rooms to upgrade to. The staff were very friendly and helpful and were sorry we were disappointed. They suggested that another single was brought into our room to make it all a bit more comfy and they did swap the blankets for crisp white duvets. However my son who slept on the fold up beds looked like he was sleeping on a prison bet. There were springs sticking out, but he managed! The staff here are very friendly and helpful and the rooms were tidied and cleaned every day with fresh towels, bathrobes and toiletries. Very handy having an iron and ironing board too. The breakfast which was extra was superb! It was the best breakfast we have had in any hotel. Despite the disappointment with the beds, I would be very happy to stay here again. Just wish they would buy some new fold-up beds, throw away the old brown blankets and give the walls a lick of paint. Our suite did not look as bright and breezy as the photo's on the website. However, the friendliness and helpfulness plus the breakfast made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gem02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last part of our honeymoon for 2 nights. The staff at reception were very helpful & we were given a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine which was very nice. The rooms were quite basic but they were clean & had everything that we needed. The location was really good - a easy walk to teh bridge, the opera house & lots of shops, cafes & restaurants. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location, pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Nadia
Reviews.Content: It's a busy part of town, so single-glazed windows didn't keep the noise out. However the location is terrific and the rooms were really pretty. The food in the restaurant was OK, but all food in Sydney is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tumshi23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbour Rocks Hotel for three nights with a friend in July. I can't speak highly enough of this Hotel. The staff, the location and the quality of the hotel were all excellent. We paid a bit more for a room with a harbour view and although you had to stand at one end of the window to see the opera house, the view (especially at night) was spectacular. The hotel is a boutique hotel in a quiet side street 5 minutes walk from the harbour side. The area is quite hilly so might not suit those with mobility problems and the hotel does not have a lift, but with only two floors this was not a problem and there is a dumb waiter system for your luggage which is helpful. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel which was not a problem as there were plenty of cafes and bars very close which served high quality food for a fraction of the price of the hotel breakfast. In saying that we did order room service one night and although it was the usual fare it was tasty and reasonably priced with good sized portions. My sister had ordered us a bottle of sparkly and chocolate strawberries as a surprise on our arrival and she found the whole process hassle free and the staff were very accommodating. It was also reasonably priced and a very much appreciated surprise! The room was nice and big and well maintained. We also had a seating area comprising sofa, arm chair and coffee table. We also had a mini bar (again reasonably priced) and a tv etc. The bathroom was a good size, with a bath, and well stocked with toiletries which were replaced daily. The staff at this hotel could not do enough for you. We flew to Sydney from Melbourne with Tiger airways (a nightmare btw) and Anabele on the front reception kindly offered to print out our boarding passes for us. She was unable to do this due to Tiger airlines awful website however she did spend time on this task and researched it thoroughly so that we were adequately equipped with enough information to refuse to pay the extra charge at the airport for not checking in online. The Rocks area was just beautiful. Lots of restaurants, shops and cute alleyways to explore. You are centrally located for accessing all points of interest and even if the weather is not great, as it was when we were there, you will still find plenty to do. We went to see toy story 3 in 3D at the IMAX which was pricey but is the largest IMAX screen in the world and it was certainly an experience worth having. I cannot wait to return to Sydney and when I do I'll definitely be returning to the Harbour Rocks Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A poor hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SkyeB
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is undeniably in a great location, I was relieved that we were only staying one night. We were put in a room on the ground floor which felt as though we'd been stuck in the basement. It was tiny, uncomfortable and very dark, with almost no natural light and only two dim artificial ones, and our queen bed was actually a double. The bathroom window had no covering and didn't close properly, with a gap at the bottom that made the room freezing. The top half of the window wasn't even frosted, meaning you could see straight into another building from the shower. Worse than all of this was the noise. The hotel backs onto a much-frequented alley in The Rocks, so we got people walking past our window constantly and were woken extremely early in the morning by the sound of things being dragged over cobblestones which went on for hours. I've stayed in much better hotels around Sydney; this one isn't worth being that little bit closer to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Podsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. The room was good and clean and the bed comfortable. Te shower was of a decent size- too many hotels skimp on the shower to squeeze a little extra space. The staff were helpful. The location is very good, I could see the Opera house from my 1st floor room. It is an easy walk to the CBD down George St, and the Opera House and Circular Quay are close. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: SueinCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the Penthouse Suite last week for 3 nights. We booked this room because we travelled with our two children, ages 10 and 15. I am sure the room we had affects my view of the hotel and it might be different if we had another room. First off, the location. As others state, it is right in the heart of the Rocks district and accessible to many of the activities that we participated in during our stay (the zoo, aquarium, circle quay, botanical garden, etc. We had to take the ferry to the zoo and aquarium, but the walk there it is not long). There are many restaurants in walking distance as well. The hotel itself is average, and we had to walk up quite a few stairs to get to our room (I think two flights, plus another to the penthouse), but it was a good workout! Accommodations - Amazing! We had a K size bed in the master room, which was quite big, full size kitchen and living room with a sofa sleeper. We brought in a rollaway so each of our children could have a bed. The King bed was very comfortable. The kitchen was convenient to have with kids. We had no noise issues (although we heard something that sounded like a generator from the master bedroom, but it didn't prevent us from sleeping). Views - Amazing! Seriously, we had our own private deck with a view of the city and Opera House. We must have taken a hundred pictures from that balcony. There was a dining table on the balcony and a jacuzzi (which really didn't work, we were told to fill it with hot water, but how hot would that really be? We didn't miss using it.) Service - it was good. We had to inquire a few times at the front desk with questions and they assisted us as needed. The front desk staff was average upon check-in. Housekeeping was quite helpful. I asked for a blanket one day and we had it in 5 minutes. We accidentally left the "do not disturb" sign on our door one day and they were concerned they couldn't come in to clean. Housekeeping brought extra towels when we got back to the hotel, which we appreciated having with 4 people showering. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area. The hotel itself is "average" to me. No elevators, an average looking lobby, etc. But because of our accommodations and the location, I thought it was a great fit for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May when I came back to Sydney to graduate from uni. The location is perfect for a weekend in the city with the Rocks Market almost outside the door, and I can highly recommend breakfast at the Lowenbrau. The room I had was small, as were the rooms my friends stayed in, however as we were each a single, it was fine and we didn't spend much time in the rooms. The room was clean enough and the bed was very comfortable for me. I did hear the crashing bottles at the end of the night, and the garbage collection in the morning, but these things don't bother me when I don't have to be up early for work! The desk staff were nice and friendly. I would stay here again and will bring my partner next time (especially because of the ghost story in the room!).

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of what you want in good location.”
Reviews.Author: vincoplanes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want location! But that's it. We stayed in a 'Heritage' room on the ground floor, rear. What a nightmare! There is an aley way with cafe's and small shops. They close late and staff are very early on the job. 4 a.m. IF YOU DON'T MIND! We were woken by voices, furniture being moved, (I assume it was the tables & chairs), wheely bins across the cobbled stones. It was just unbelievable. Right through to 7.30 and then the early morning patrons. The room had a high ceiling and even with the heater on we were cold. If you put on the overhead fan to push down the heat, you had to put up with the woo woo woo of the fan! No impressed and will not go back. BE WARY, BE AWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: jrcohea
Reviews.Content: As the name implies, the hotel is located in the Rocks area of Sydney. This makes the location perfect for many nearby activities and the Sydney Opera House is less than a 10 minute walk. We stayed in a Junior Suite at the hotel, which had a bedroom, living area, bathroom, and entry room. The space wasn't abundant, but enough to spread a bit. The bathroom was pretty small, but it was manageable for two people. The staff was friendly and everything was neat and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: solotrvllr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harbour Rocks Hotel for a week and got pretty good value for the location. Situated in the heart of the Rocks district, it's less than a minute's walk to the Sydney Tourist information centre, about 2 minutes from nightlife, pubs, and good eats in the Rocks. A pleasant 5 minute walk to Circular Quay and a little further from there to the Sydney Opera House and CBD. I was pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms; housekeeping kept the room spotless, and the bathrooms clean. However, the walls are rather thin and noise from other rooms carried. The only thing that annoyed me was housekeeping slamming doors starting from 7AM. After having complained to the management about it, it stopped the next morning, only to start again the morning after! The hotel had no lift so I had to walk up the stairs to get to my room. The hotel also has no complementary wireless internet. I would rate this as a three star hotel, overpriced due to the central location, but overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Doodstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for 1 night at this hotel. It was in a fabulous area - a 5 minute walk from Circular Quay. So we caught the train in from the airport to Circular Quay - easy. Right near the Rocks Market, plenty of eateries. We had breakfast there and sat out in a small garden terrace overlooking the street. Just terrific. I would not hesitate to stay there again - an easy walk to lots of attractions. Fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable straightforward hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: UKJaneW
Reviews.Content: Great location, huge room, comfortable bed, unbelievably powerful shower, excellent help-yourself breakfast with plenty of choice, nosy parrots, helpful staff. In retrospect I wouldn't have paid extra for the view of the Sydney Opera House, as the view was fairly limited.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Rocks = outstanding choice - a great convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wgrbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Nov 2009 prior to Rhapsody of the Seas cruise as the Overseas Terminal is simply across the road. We got upgraded to Harbour View Room from Internet booked basic twin = excellent! Thanx so much to Management! This place is totally central, ( we caught the train from Airport to Blue Mountains then returned to Central Station). Hoel is cute, clean, comfortable, historic, with oustanding views of harbour & close to all things Rocks. Stairs are OK (big sigh) luggage is carried up for you ( thank heavens). Staff were outstandingly helpful and very respectful. Thankyou for a lovely stay - We will definitely return - I am recommending you to any one who will listen!! Thanks G. Bartlett.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Comfortable Friendly and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: MatureTravellersAus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed mid week in standard room located on Ground floor. Staff were friendly and helpful. Whilst its not the best of the best the place was clean, comfortable and perfectly located in the historic rocks precinct within walking distance of all of the city attractions and Circular Quays transport . If you are after good honest accommodation without all of the unneccessary "extras" then the Harbour Rocks Hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JoanneE4
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very close to the bridge. Nice restaurants, cafes around it. Room was large enough for the five of us.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: SandiJL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Rocks in June 2001 and loved the location. We could walk to everything, and the people at the hotel were great with helping us set up tours, and suggesting fun things to do. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Aussiechick034
Reviews.Content: We must have had the worse room in the hotel as it was over the kitchen and was very noisy (especially at 0500 in the morning when they shifted the empty bottles from the restaurant in a wire cage). When the shower next door was on it was akin to someone with a high pressure hose going down a drain pipe. A person of size would not have got through the door of the shower as the ensuite was the size of a shoe box. As for the complementary tea and coffe.... that was laughable.... we were left 2 coffee and 4 sugar sachets on 4 of the 7 days we were there and nothing on the others. One day we got 1 little 20mil milk and 2 days no milk at all. (one of those little milks wouldn't even colour my tea). The room was full of mosquitos the first night we were ther so we asked for a can of Mortein.... They left a can alright,,, but it was empty!! I could go on being "picky" but I'll leave it at that.......... No I can't recomend this hotel..... Maybe we just got lucky and got the worse room inthe place.......... But one thing is for sure, next time I'm in Sydney I won't be staying at the Harbour Rocks Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: walterWales
Reviews.Content: Good location in the Rocks . Convenient for Circular Quay, and a number of excellent restaurants within walking distance. Rooms rather dowdy, but good breakfast and staff were very acccomodating in room availability , being used to early arrivals and late departures.

Reviews.Title: “"Good Place to Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Phil1052
Reviews.Content: It is close to all the attractions in The Rocks, and easy walking distance to the Opera House and Circular Quay. There are many places to eat near-by, the hotel restruant is good, but many other choices near. The room was clean and well kept. I would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Well Located for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: LostAussie18
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the Harbour Rocks. The last being a year ago. Once again, we enjoyed its great location to the Harbour and all the good restaurants in The Rocks. The rooms are reasonably well equipped and of moderate size. Our room was clean and comfortable and very good value for its fantastic location. Dont expect the Ritz, but they dont charge those prices either. The hotel has the charm of the historic Rocks area and is much better than staying in just another high rise hotel in the main part of the city. Staff were efficient and friendly. There is a small restaurant and bar on site, but lots of options within metres of the door. Next door is a Bar/Restaurant called Philips Foote, where you can cook your own steak on BBQ's in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AndyP80
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights in this little gem tucked away in the heart of "The Rocks". Its about a 5 minute walk from central quay and there's plenty to explore just near the hotel itself. Rooms were good, my parents room on arrival had a very strong smell of garlic for some reason, however there was no problem in moving to another room. Our room was very nice, nothing mising at all. Reception staff were excellant, couldn't do enough to help with ny info. Breakfast is availaible at the hotel but being situated in the rock you'd foolish not to explore the nearby cafe's and other options. We can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of history!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelBriz
Reviews.Content: One of the oldest buildings in Sydney with an interesting history.Great position in the Rocks, walking distance to everything. Modern furnishings, very comfortable bed. Our room was small but was clean and had everything we needed. Good restaurants, bars etc close by. Recommend the Rocks tour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: renee44
Reviews.Content: Great location. It was a very easy walk to opera house, ferries, trains and hop on/hop off bus stop. We stayed a full week. There was no noise on weeknights and just a little on Friday and Saturday. It wasnâ€™t enough to bother us. But if you are a light sleeper and get an unlucky room position, I could see how it might be an issue for some. Also, with the heavy brick walls and high ceilings, there was no noise from other guest rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a laundry room if you want to do a load or two yourself. They also offer laundry service. I would stay there again if I could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingwithfool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Rocks one night but it was great. We were within walking distance to everything that we wanted to see. The hotel is nice, rooms were on the small size, but clean. There is no elevator but there is a luggage elevator. Cannot beat the location. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the area.”
Reviews.Author: YEBO
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 days here in January and loved the area. The hotel was pleasant, the room clean, good A/C and lovely toiletries in the bathroom. We had an ordinary meal one evening but no complaints about anything. The staff professional, and the lack of a lift was no problem. Close to all the local attractions and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: charliewp
Reviews.Content: We chose the Harbour Rocks Hotel as we have always wanted to stay in 'The Rocks' to experience and observe some of our colonial history. The hotel is central to all you would want to do and see in Sydney during a short stay. The Opera House is only a short walk as is the Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay. The Rocks markets are at the end of the block with lots of restaurants and pubs close by. Yes the hotel is small and there is no lift but who would let that get in the way of having a great stay? Staff were lovely, only too happy to help with our requests and the room was clean and air-conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: oz2u
Reviews.Content: What a quaint hotel! Only downside is that there is not much signane out the front - when driving past I missed it a couple of times! Friendly reception staff, the afternoon girl was a little abrupt, but the duty manager was quite lovely. Our room was a heritage room, and honsetly I was expecting a dingy little bathroom, but was pleasantly suprised with a sparkling, clean modern one! The little amenities smelt divine too(not the norm!). Was very pleased with the cleanliness of the room and air con! No problems walking stairs instead of lifts, although probably not wheelchair or miobility impaired friendly! Overall, superb location with all the mod-cons you're not expecting!

Reviews.Title: “Amateurs!!”
Reviews.Author: Antz18
Reviews.Content: My fiance had been given a gift voucher by his ex-employer for a night in a Harbour View Room at the Hotel. When we arrived on the day they told us that our Harbour View Room had been given away. We were given no explanation about why our room had been given away. When we asked why no one from the Hotel had called us to tell us that our room had been given away so that we could have booked the room on another day, the Hotel told us they had called the person who bought us the voucher. We told them that this was ridiculous and after kicking up a big enough fuss the Hotel put us up in a junior suite, gave us a complimentary sparkling wine and free parking. The room was nice enough however we could not open the window as the very strong smell of frying garlic and onion all night and in the morning from the restaurant below was unbearable. In short I have stayed in many hotels in Sydney and I found Harbour Rocks to be very amateurish. They didn't seem to know what they were doing.

Reviews.Title: “really good....!”
Reviews.Author: kingrox
Reviews.Content: .... my wife and i stayed at the harbour rocks hotel this past weekend in the historic rocks area in sydney.. its only a 2 minute walk to circular quay and all the quay attractions... we booked due to the good reviews here on trip advisor (we love this tool!!) and we were not dissapointed - it was great value, great spot, very clean, intimate, great staff and the resident ghost left us well alone...! after a 40 dollar cab fare from the airport (this includes the tunnel option - its heaps quicker) Our check in was simple.. our room was perfect and guess what - OUR WINDOWS OPENED! - YES! the location is perfect.. its smack bang in the middle of the historic rocks precinct and is surrounded by historic resturants and things to see. (including the markets) the hotel itself is small and 'boutiyqey' and is much better than stayin at a faceless 5 star...! we walked to circular quay in 5 min and around to the opera house in 10 min. well done to the harbour rocks - i will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just don't plan on getting any sleep”
Reviews.Author: DanNZ
Reviews.Content: Avoid at all costs! We have stayed at this hotel on two previous occasions and found it central and convenient although pricey for what you get. For the record it is quaint and clean with at least one reasonable sized room, though there are no lifts and the restaurant is on the average side of average. On this occasion we were kept awake until 3am on one night and 1am the next night by the nightclub across the road. There is no double glazing and no intention of fitting it apparently. The management response was that there was nothing they could do about it, the attitude was "we've got your money and we don't care". No wonder they asked us to pay up front! You have a 50% chance of getting some sleep here and if you have any problems the management will tell you to get lost. For the price this is unacceptable and you can do a lot better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Feltzerelli
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel a week prior to arrival, to request one of the Harbour View Rooms as I was planning on proposing on the night of our stay. I popped in the day before to ask for champagne to be put in the room. On arrival the following day, without giving anything away the receptionists advised that we had been upgraded to the Penthouse Suite. The Suite was stunning with a great view of the Opera House. The staff couldn't have been friendlier, and our stay was an absolute pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fatherfigure
Reviews.Content: This is a characterful hotel set right in the heart of the Rocks. The location couldn't be better; close to all the sights and restaurants. There is a restaurant on site, which is fine. Breakfasts OK here, but better (and cheaper) at the Gum Nut cafe down the road. Rooms are well equiped and comfortable.
