Only problem with our room was that it was on the ground floor, right next to the road, so no good for a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Rubiru
Reviews.Content: It took us 3 rooms and an upgrade to manage our 5night stay. I wouldn't rate this as terrible but maybe i'm too polite. Thankfully when you are in Syndey you are not in your room much. The lower floors are dark and although not damp, have a feeling of dampness. My husband occassionally suffers from a bad chest and he knew he could not stay in these room. We finally got a room on the top floor which was better, not great, but better. The hotel is in a very busy area so if you are a light sleeper I suggest you don't stay here or have some good ear plugs! The only thing good about this hotel is the location. It is near some great bars and a fabulous restaurant just around the corner where you cook your own meat on the barb and the vege's are great too. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but......”
Reviews.Author: Robby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in January at the beginning of our month long trip to Australia. It was booked through a travel agent. My request for the trip was boutique hotels with character, charm, and or history. I said we did not necessarily want to pay top dollar but would if the property was worth it. So overall was looking for something middle of the road. Pros: This hotel has an excellent location. It was very convenient for us to walk everywhere. Staff was ok. They did help us with our luggage and put it on the luggage lift for us. Bathroom was small but convenient. It does have history as it was convict built. Cons:There is no guest elevator so if stairs are a problem this place is not for you. The rooms are small and really do not have any charm. Furnishings are dated and the whole place smelled musty. The view is mostly of roof tops. Overall, not much character to the place either. It was convict built but used as a warehouse mostly, I think. Our air conditioner did not work and the last night it broke. It started spraying water in a fine mist and we noticed water leaking down the wall. Then it started buzzing. It buzzed for about a minute every 22 minutes. Apparently, this was the water tank trying to empty but it was unable to so the water leaked and sprayed. We turned it off which stopped it from spraying and leaking but the noise continued. We attempted to get our room changed but nothing was available. We tried to sleep as best we could but with it buzzing every 22 minutes it was difficult!!!!! Upon check out the next morning staff said they would not charge the travel agency for our last night but could not give us any credit directly as we only had a voucher and they had not received payment yet. We just got back and do not know if we will receive anything from our travel agency but would not recommend this hotel if you want to be assured of a good night's sleep. Must be something better in this price range even if you have to forfeit location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lacks some amenities”
Reviews.Author: Litlvxn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. This hotel is right in the middle of the Rocks area and is within an easy 5 to 10 minute walk from the Circular Quay area. Circular Quay is where the Opera House and the sightseeing ferries are located, making this a very convenient hotel. I did not choose this hotel since it was chosen for me as part of an add-on package by Brendan Travel. The hotel itself is described as a "boutique" hotel and does have some charm since it has some historic qualities. The standard rooms seemed very small. I traveled alone and seemed cramped with my two (albeit large) suitcases for my cruise. There are no elevators for the 3 story hotel. There is however a "luggage elevator" that can be awkward. No one offered to help me with this, but the instructions themselves were self-explanatory. I smacked my head pretty good though. Once upstairs there are a few small stairs to some rooms so luggage had to be lifted here and there. I never pack what I can't lift myself so not a big deal to me. In general this hotel is not for anyone with mobility issues. The cobblestone sidewalks leading up to it, and the lack of elevators inside, could be something to consider. The harbor view of the Opera House was minimal, instead mostly courtyards and rooftops. You can however see whatever large cruise ship is in port directly from your window. I didn't mind that since it was my ship I woke up to seeing. The windows are the roll-out type with both screens that were in need of repair. The rooms came equipped with umbrellas for use, which was a nice touch. Overall I would say that this small hotel was in a perfect location from which to start touring Sydney, and it definitely had "historical character", but if you're looking for luxurious amenities or large rooms, you may want to look elsewhere. It definitely is not a standard "chain" or high-rise hotel, which might please some and might disappoint others.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour Rocks Delivered”
Reviews.Author: American35-40
Reviews.Content: Quaint, clean hotel in great area of the Rocks near Circular Quay. Surrounded by bars, cafes and restaurants. We stayed September 4 to 7th, 2007. Great view of the Opera House from the window of our room. Staff were earnest and generally knowledgeable. Very good value for the price of $250AUD.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at the Harbour Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Carol0743
Reviews.Content: We booked the Harbour Rocks Hotel for an upmarket weekend in Sydney, close to the Opera House. It was at the more expensive end of the 4 star hotel range so that was what we expected. We got a standard 3 star hotel. There was no lift, the room was small and the bathroom too. Location was good but price very expensive when better hotels in equally good locations cost less for much better rooms and reception. We choose to have dinner in the restaurant, Lanes. There was a 10% discount for hotel guests. We let staff know that we had only an hour for dinner and choose fish on their recommendation. The fish arrived after 50 minutes, cold and overcooked with cold, hard chips. We did not eat it and went to the Opera without any dinner. The restaurant charged us for our appetiser and bread!! This hotel and the restauant are definately the poorest we have stayed at in the nearly one hundred hotels we have stayed at in Sydney CBD. Avoid it if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: kilteragh
Reviews.Content: Ideally located near the Rocks,Harbour bridge and Opera House.A great location to stay as their is beautiful shops and things to do near by.Hotel is lovely and clean and there is a relaxed atmosphere.Resturant is also good. I would definetly recommend it for those that want a break form the hussle and bustle yet be on the doorstep of the most amazing places in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: tjw3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, and the rooms are smaller. But you need to keep in mind that you are staying in the middle of the rocks for half the price of the other hotels. The building is a beautiful old heritage building situated right in the heart of the rocks. The rooms are small but cosy and it is priced well. If you want large and flashy you need to pay a lot more. If you are looking for a base in the rocks at a reasonable price this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “cosy intimate great location”
Reviews.Author: MillyCat2000
Reviews.Content: this hotel is clean comfortable cosy and intimate and in a great location. we had a room with bridge and opera house views. great breafasts taken on the balcony

Reviews.Title: “brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: arecentvisitorUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights just before Easter this year. we had read varying reviews on Trip Advisor but liked the overall sound of the hotel. We were not disappointed in any way. The position was perfect - a short walk (3 minutes) to Circular Quay and the opera house. George Street shopping area also within easy reach. The room we had was spacious with a good sized bathroom, nice toiletries, ample tea and coffee, information about the city. We heard no traffic noise despite the central position of the hotel. Breakfast was excellent - huge choice and we could eat on the balcony outside when the sun shone! The staff were helpful and truly friendly - not just the coporate bolt on smiles one can meet. We even had a distant view of the opera house from our room and rates were not at all expensive for Sydney in such a prime position Easter week. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The right location and price for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: JodieTravel01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Harbour Rocks for one night. We booked this hotel because of price and location. It delivered on both critera. From our research - the cheaper rooms were 1/3 - 1/2 the price of other hotels in the area. Our room on the ground floor was small (especially the bathroom) but clean, the bed and pillows were comfortable and it had all the standard hotel amenities e.g. toiletries, hardryer, tea and coffee making facilities etc. Upon entering, the room did have a mild smokey smell but we couldn't detect it once we had been in there for a few minutes. Location wise it was great, close (max 5 mins walk) to Sydney harbour, the train, ferry and all the restaurants and shops in the Rocks area. Be aware that the Rocks area rocks (literally) on a Saturday night, so depending where your room is located you may get some nightclub or street noise. Because we were at the back of the hotel and on the ground floor we couldn't hear anything. Check in/check out was efficient. We were attending a wedding, so there were 3 other couples we knew staying in the hotel, we were all reasonably happy but we weren't in our rooms much. Be aware, however, that it is not five star and is an older hotel and priced accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Rocks Magic”
Reviews.Author: Malcourt
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Harbour Rocks Hotel in early April, our third time at this great Rocks gem. We can empathise with other reviews regarding the limited Harbour views from the standard rooms, however we were lucky enough to have the Penthouse Suite for our stay, and can only rave about the position and views - there are no floor to ceiling windows, but you are so close to the action, and you have opening windows, and a large private rooftop terrace with an outdoor setting big enough for 8, and a 4 person spa/jaccuzzi. There is a full view of the Opera House from the Lounge, Dining and Terrace areas, and plenty of water as well. Looking the other way provided the city-scape view. The suite was fully self-contained (although the nifty laundry had a space for a washing machine with no machine!), with all kitchen appliances, crockery, cutlery provided, meaning we did not have to eat all our meals out .This helped offset the higher price for the room. The bedroom is large with a comfortable KS bed, tv etc., the galley kitchen was functional and the lounge dining area adequate. We stayed with our two children (8 & 10), so the couch was folded out to become a bed at night-time. The decor is stylish and practical, though starting to show its age a little. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous. The one drawback of this great room is that due to the historic nature of the building, there is only a luggage lift, so coming to and from your room on the 4th floor will keep you fit! The location speaks for itself - we left the car parked for 4 days, catching the bus to Bondi one day, and the ferry to the Zoo another. Mind you, $30 per day for parking the car is pretty steep for those of us from the country! Finally, it's hard to beat your own spa under the stars in the centre of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Stay at the Harbour Rocks Hotel, Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: VagabondRuralPA
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Rocks Hotel, Sydney, Australia was a dump. It was no more than a Bed and Breakfast and it was definitely not a four-star hotel. The room smelled musty and awful. The odor was prevalent throughout our four night stay at this dump. The room and bathroom were so small that if you wanted to change your mind, you would have to go outside to do so. The bathroom barely accommodated one person at a time. The shower door was so small that you had to enter the shower sideways. There was literally no room between the shower stall and the toilet in this very small bathroom. Reported a hall light directly outside our room was burned out immediately upon arrival. Took the hotel staff two days to repair the inoperable light bulb. In the interim, we had to enter and exit our room in the dark. Room was dirty and noisy. We heard police sirens, loud talking and yelling in the street and the cafe area below our room, as well as constant banging of hotel room doors throughout the nights. The hotel needed a total refurbishment and upgrading. Furniture was old and outdated. Walls and carpet were dirty and worn. It's an old hotel in need of a lot of work. Contacted our travel agent, Goway Travel, and requested a change in hotel accommodations. Unfortunately, Goway Travel would do nothing to assist us with the lousy hotel booking they provided us with at this less than four-star hotel. They had our money and planned to do nothing additional to assist us, other than to request additional funds, to resolve a very bad situation created by their booking. Would never recommend or use the Harbour Rocks Hotel, Sydney. Likewise, would never use or recommend Goway Travel for travel bookings anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Building....but”
Reviews.Author: AkamaiWahine
Reviews.Content: some of the staff is lacking social skills and traning...as far as the harbour view, when we checked in, the room was larger but not a good view excepting roof tops and buidlings with a sliver of the Harbour. But when we asked for another room, they politely let us look at a smaller room that had a better view of the Opera House. At this price and the age of the building (we picked it for the age and history), it has a decent view and the rooms are nice. Not the Four Seasons, but your not paying for that (plus 4s is just another high rise). A fabulous location in the middle of The Rocks area and one of the oldest buildings. Some of the staff were pleasant and helpful, some not, and avoid the restaraunt (Lane's) at least for breakfast. Server was horrible and the meal was overpriced! We'd stay again despite the small complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Fimbis
Reviews.Content: it has taken some time to get over our disappointment with the hotel after anticipating our stay since july 06 having read so many good reviews we are not spoilt travellers having stayed in caravans . tents , B&B's and every level of hotel all over the world. with that experience we should have checked the size of the room before we reserved and the facilities on offer in those rooms. we had booked a standard room not realising how small they are and that for the 6 days we were staying we should have requested a superior room or a suite . on arrival at 8am having been traveling since 4am that morning we discovered our room was not possible have 2 bedside tables and open the wardrobe there was scant storage for 2 adults on a 4 week trip (who were not backpackers). the helpful staff instantly offered an alternative which had no shelves or drawers unless we removed the drinking glasses from the drawer next to the minibar. the third and final room was larger but the only window was approx 12" square and we could not be in australia in the summer and not wake up to the sunshine or see the sky. at that point depite their best efforts we were told that they had exausted all the available possibilities. we then went for a walk to think about it and get somthing to drink as it was midday we visited the tourist office to ask advice .they suggested another hotel ( The Menzies, Large, Clean and a ten min from Circular Quay With great staff and very good service) which they booked and sorted out payment on our behalf (a very good deal) we returned to the hotel to discover that a much better room had become avilable but we were unable to accept the offer as we had paid for the second hotel. Initially we were charged a cancellation fee for one days room but later that day the hotel relented and refunded the fee. our friends who arrived the next day were happy with their larger room at the harbour rocks but also a little disappointed the staff attitude. we wondered if there had been a recent change of management and were suprised how ordinary the rooms and ensuites were were after all the reviews we had read we expected charm and grace and it was our first and only dissapointment throughout our trip to OZ .

Reviews.Title: “Relax at the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Hil-Harv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Rocks Hotel for four nights and arrived back in England yesterday. The hotel is located in the old settlement area of Sydney and has great character. The accomodation was good with well appointed bedroom including t.v. ,coffee,tea and fridge. The bathroom had a walk-in shower and loads of hot water and the bed was very comfortable. The continental breakfast menu was very good indeed and there was no need for full English. The staff,especially at reception, were excellent and went out of there way to help in every way. The only complaint one could have is there is no alternative to the stairs so is not suitable for the less than able bodied. Luggage is delivered to rooms via a luggage elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne on the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Louisie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a romantic night, and was not dissapointed. The staff are the best i've delt with. (and i've travelled Europe) Katie, and Paul could not have been more gracious or friendly, right down to the champagne and greeting card on arrival.A lovely touch. The room was spotless, the bathroom had a double size shower,and we had a great little view of the Opera House.The great thing i noticed was you had no noise at all from people coming or going in the room's next door, and all the staff are very discreet.Ate at Lanes restaurant in the hotel, food was very good and the courtyard is a nice spot complete with lovely old tree.Breakfast is a must out there, huge cooked breakfast that you really have trouble getting through, and great selection of fruits, cold meats, cheeses, breads etc everything you want for a lazy Sunday breakfast including your paper.The location is the best, step out the door to explore all the Rocks has to offer.For a night away, or an oversea's visit, don't go past this gem of a hotel.It's small enough to give you great service with a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Very Reasonably Priced, Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the top floor at rear of hotel, could just see the opera house roof and harbour for 4 nights in June 2006, as it was out of season managed to get a very, very reduced room rate (especially for Sydney), so do try to negotiate price in winter months when they are quiet. Not the most luxurious of hotels, but very clean, well maintained and very helpful, cheerful staff, great value for money. Our room was quite small and basic, shower was wonderful, most powerful shower I have ever known and you could fit 3 people in it, but as another reviewer has mentioned - the sink was very small and water splashed everywhere if you tried to have a wash!! Agree with everyone else, location,location,location - you cant fault it, our room was very quiet wenever heard a noise, but on the doorstep and within walking distance for all major attractions, yet great holiday rather than city centre feel as located in historic and interesting part of city. Very near Tourist Info Centre and crafty type shops and lots of good restaurants. Breakfast excellent, very varied and large portions, did not eat in hotel at night but it looked pleasant enough. Overall we felt hotel had a nice family atmosphere as opposed to the usual inpersonal large chain of hotels which you find in every city in the world now. Would definitely recommend it, as lets face it with a wonderful city like Sydney you're not going to be in your hotel room very much anyway, so why pay a fortune!!

Reviews.Title: “Great intro to OZ”
Reviews.Author: egerstan
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first three nights in Australia at the Harbor Rocks Hotel. A great location and very comfortable. We especially enjoyed the sunny, pleasant room where breakfast was served. Staff was always very pleasant and helpful; we were on the first floor (one above ground) and had no issues with stairs or lack of elevator. Also not too bothered by the noise that others have mentioned and really liked the convenience and ambiance of being the historic Rocks area, close by the Opera House, Circular Quay, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay there !”
Reviews.Author: Kotakot
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in December and we just loved it. We travelled around the country for nearly 1 month (honey Moon) and clearly this hotel was one of our favorite. We actually stayed there 3 nights, then went to Blue Mountains and came back for our last night in Australia. As per arrangement that we had, this last night was indeed a "free night" and we were upgrated in a bigger room with view on the Opera house. This was a really nice attention because standards room are a bit small (but however comfortable and well furnished). The staff was very helpful and all our requests have been handeled very professionally. We also enjoyed the bar, there is a nice terrace and a good choice of beer and wines. The location of the hotel is just perfect and we would definitly go there if we had to stay in Sydney again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location: Beware street level rooms”
Reviews.Author: Happyholl
Reviews.Content: Everyone else has said evrything there is to be said about the location: great. I would also add that the rooms are clean and well appointed, BUT if you can, make sure that you don't get one on the front at street level. Passers by could literally be looking at you in the eye if you looked out of the window. AND the road can be quite noisy with traffic in the morning. My wife also wasn't too pleased to see a plaque hanging up in the room explaining about the resident ghost who sometimes walks the hotel!!! We didn't eat in the hotel (too close to Circular Key and the Rocks, and I would agree with the the reviewers about the place round the corner with the courtyard for breakfast. Another thing to note, is that the in-house movies are free to view, although they play at set times, rather than you being able to watch them whenever you want. Other than the location of our room, though, no particular complaints. For a modestly priced hotel with good location, it would be difficult to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: brackla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our three-day trip to Sydney, and given we begun our trip in the Hotel Lindrum, Melbourne, were really looking forward to staying in another hotel owned by the same company. Although it's not up to the same standard, or level of luxury, it is a lot cheaper, and what gives this hotel the edge is it's location - in the shadow of the Harbour Bridge and just minutes from Sydney Harbour. Being in centre of the Rocks, a great area for bars, restaurants (Rockpool is just around the corner) it's a convenient base for a short stay. The hotel itself is clean and tidy, but the room we stayed in was a bit noisy (we could hear the service lift clanking through the night), so perhaps not recommended for light sleepers. We didn't eat in the hotel but instead chose the fantastic Gum Nut cafe, just a few doors up for breakfast in their courtyard each morning.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel failed us”
Reviews.Author: apros
Reviews.Content: What a disaster! After travelling all the way from Toronto to Sydney, a highlight was to visit a friend. This hotel failed to give us phone messages twice! This undermines the very good aspects of this hotel - but since there was only one person we had come to visit while is Sydney, and didn't get either of the two messages left for us, it undid all the good physical aspects of this hotel. Rooms do NOT have voice mail. Messages are slipped under your door - they say! One of our messages was found on their computer - but not delivered to our room. What did they offer? An apology!!!! I had noticed this same complaint by someone on Tripadvisor prior to our trip. Therefore, I frequently checked at front desk for messages. Evidently that was of no help either. And each time I did, I was told that IF there were a message, it would be delivered to our room!!! Don't believe. And when we tried to speak to the manager or assistant manager prior to checking out, they refused to make themselves available to us. This hotel is located perfectly for touring. Small comfortable rooms - with bathrooms that are poorly planned (small is OK. But no decent shelf for a woman to put her cosmetics on!) Remember - no elevator for people, just for baggage. Didn't bother us. But we never got to see the friend we wanted to see!! And the hotel refused to make any sort of financial offer to compensate for their mistake - even though one undelivered message was clearly logged in their computer! Take your chances. Us? We've got a bad taste in our mouth. Across the street is the Stafford Hotel which looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: Jigsaw68
Reviews.Content: Harbour Rocks was only two minutes from Circular Quay, and steps from great restaurants and cafes. Of all the locations we visited in Sydney, the Rocks was the most pedestrian friendly and seemed to have its fair share of quaint outdoor cafes, and boutique shops. Our room was street level but still pretty quiet (except on St. Patrick's Day night!). Rooms are small, for sure. Breakfast at the hotel is VERY expensive - $25 per person, but there are lots of quaint cafes close by where you can get coffee and a pastry in the morning. The staff was very sweet and helpful. Try the outdoor noodle bar (can't remember the name) located out the door to the right of the hotel for an inexpensive, tasty meal. Also, the pub to the right and one street up has good fish and chips. A neat way to spend sunset is to buy a roundtrip ticket from the harbor to Neutral Bay. The ferry ride is spectacular at night. Another neat thing to do around sunset is the Obersvatory, which is nearby. I usually like to stay in the bigger, more luxurious hotels but didn't miss them this time. In walking around, the only hotel of which I was jealous of the location was the Park Hyatt, which had rooms with balconies right on the bay. Park Hyatt was massively expensive though. Sydney Rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about this hotel - close to the Opera House, in midst of historic district, etc. The rooms are clean, as are the bathrooms, but don't have any charm. And forget about reading in bed - too dark. Also, there is no elevator, so if you have a problem with stairs, this place is not for you. All in all, I'd recommend it for the location and cleanliness, but if you want atmosphere, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Rocks Hotel is an older hotel and the hotel has a certain charm to it. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and the bathrooms have been modernized. There is a restaurant within the hotel that services a delicious breakfast (which the hotel gives you a 10% off coupon for your breakfast). The hotel's location is very convenient. We walked everywhere and saw all the sites. There are plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from within walking distance. What made our stay very pleasant was the Harbour Rocks' staff. Extremely friendly and helpfull with "good" restaurant recommendations. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tpuryear
Reviews.Content: Our room was quiet and comfortable with a view of the Sydney Opera House. Convenient to the Quay, the Wharf and all points in the Rocks. A perfect finish to our trip to Australia. Situated right above the Nurses Walk and next to the Suez Canal, both historic locations in the Rocks. On our last night in Sydney and Australia, we watched fireworks from our window!

Reviews.Title: “Nice use of an older commercial building”
Reviews.Author: Rance2
Reviews.Content: The Harbour Rocks hotel fits in well with the rest of the historical Rocks area. It has maintained the facade and much of the internal features of an older commerical store building. The large rooms use a modern Australian decor that fits in with the retained rustic architectural features. The result is a feeling of warmth. It is difficult to fault the rooms. The staff are very helpful. As a plus, everywhere in the Rocks area is within easy walking distance. It is an experience that canâ€™t be had staying at the larger chain hotels which, due to city zoning codes, have been kept at bay to the south of the Cahill Expressway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Rocks hotel in August for a week, as part of our honeymoon. It was fantastic. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room we had was great - we even had a slight view of the Opera House. It was worth paying a bit more for the location - a few steps from the hotel and your at circular quay with the Opera House and Bridge before you. It also means that it's the best location to catch the ferry to Manly, Watsons Bay, Taronga Zoo etc... A recommendation for a fantastic breakfast is the little cafe, with a courtyard, a couple of doors down from the entrance to the hotel. We will definatly stay here again
